item.title: Two-Sum
item.description: Approach 1: Brute Force O(n^2) Approach 2 : Two-pass Hash Table O(n) / O(n) Approach 3 : One-pass Hash Table O(n) / O(n) python def two_sum(nums: List[int], target: int) -> list[int]: table = {} for v, i in enumerate(nums): remain = target - v if remain not in table.keys(): table[v] = i else: return [table[remain], i]

item.description: This article was really helpful to understand where I start it from. Read this before you start solving problems on Leetcode (Prep Work) | by Ali Mir | Medium

item.title: Kakao Clone
item.description: Archive of old projects Cloned UI of Kakao talk which is the most famous messenger in South Korea. Learned how to make UI elements by using HTML and CSS, especially flex layout. Chats | Kakao Clone

item.title: Change Jekyll to Hugo
item.description: Jekyll had some issues with MD to HTML parser, so we found other static site generators. We considered Hugo and Gatsby, and decided to go with Hugo. There are several reasons why. faster simple less dependency (less plugins though) Template is cleaned and Young made it as Hugo-theme. Bear-exporter (it is named as Pizzly now ü§©) is also applied all differences. Gatsby looks great but seems much similar to Wordpress.

item.title: MIT 6.000x on edX
item.description: Materials Computational Thinking using Python XSeries Program | edX 6.0001 6.0002 Course overview This course is focusing on introducing programming concepts and basic algorithms. It has a similar position with CS50 of Harvard but I felt that it‚Äôs more related to my purpose which is checking if any missing parts on python programming. Lecture is available on both Youtube and edX. I like Youtube version more though. Assignment and exam is similar but edX version is a bit easier than offline class materials.

item.title: About me
item.description: Hello, I‚Äôm Jae üòÅ üî≠ I‚Äôm working at the animation studio as pipeline TD, especially focusing on the lighting and compositing side. I also keep learning CS for being better engineer in this industry through the materials from all around the world. All of this journey started from a tiny step of python scripting while working as lighter. Hope that I can go deeper inside and contribute for the artists, industry and the communities.

item.title: Bear notes export to Jekyll posts
item.description: Intro What we‚Äôve done call bear notes from Local DB, and parse them save them as .md for Jekyll posts, and generate pages automatically What we‚Äôve learned How the apple devices are synced Query sqlite3 database by python What we are planning to do further Making simple MacOS app UI using pyQT

item.title: Math for CS Overview
item.description: Single Variable Calculus - MIT OCW 18.01 Multivariable Calculus Differential Equations Linear Algebra - TRU + MIT combo Math for Computer Science (A.K.A Discrete Math) 1 - TRU + MIT combo Math for Computer Science (A.K.A Discrete Math) 2 Numerical Analysis Probability and Statistics 1 - TRU + MIT combo Probability and Statistics 2
